alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 11:20PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL FRANKLIN COUNTY THROUGH 1145 PM EDT... At 1120 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ferrum, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ferrum... and Callaway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
